prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Chief Attorney at Fey & Co.. My boss, and a very good defense attorney.
Character 1
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mia's little sister. Found bent over her sister's body, crying.
Character 2
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 3
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: A gifted prosecutor, and a ruthless man who'd do anything to get a "guilty" verdict.
Character 4
Name: April May
Description: An eye witness to the events. Testifies that she saw Maya commit the murder.
Character 5
Name: Marvin Grossberg
Description: A veteran defense attorney, and Mia's mentor.
Character 6
Name: Bellboy
Description: Bellboy at the Gatewater Hotel.
Character 7
Name: Redd White
Description: An eye witness. CEO of the information gathering company, Bluecorp.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: The Thinker
Description: The murder weapon. Looks like a statue, but it's actually a clock. Made by Larry Butz. Clock in the form of a statue. The clock's gears have been removed. Made by Larry Butz.
Evidence 2
Name: Glass Shards
Description: The broken remains of a glass light stand. Broken beyond all recognition.
Evidence 3
Name: Receipt
Description: A department store receipt with letters written in blood on the back. Receipt for a glass light stand. The date of purchase is the day before the murder.
Evidence 4
Name: Maya's Memo
Description: "A conversation I had with my sister is recorded on my cell phone."
Evidence 5
Name: Mia's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 9/5 at 9:00PM. Cause: single blunt force trauma. Death was instantaneous. Died from a blow by a blunt object. May have lived for a few minutes after being hit.
Evidence 6
Name: Maya's Cell Phone
Description: Holds a conversation between the Chief and Maya. Click here for details.
Evidence 7
Name: Wiretap
Description: Found in Miss May's hotel room.
Evidence 8
Name: Floor Plans
Description: The murder scene, the Fey & Co. Law Offices. Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: May Testimony
Description: "The victim dodged an attack then ran to the right, but she was caught and struck."
Evidence 10
Name: Photograph
Description: On the back the words "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit A" are written in pencil.
Evidence 11
Name: Photograph
Description: On the back the words "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit B" are written in pencil.
Evidence 12
Name: Bellboy's Affidavit
Description: Describes the man who stayed with Miss May in the hotel on the night of the murder.
Evidence 13
Name: Newspaper Clipping
Description: Article about politician's suicide. The word "White" is written in pen at the top.
Evidence 14
Name: Mia's Memo
Description: A list of people's names in Mia's handwriting.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: After securing the suspect, I examined the scene of the crime with my own eyes.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: I found a memo written on a piece of paper next to the victim's body!
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: On it, the word "Maya" was written clearly in blood!
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: Lab test results showed that the blood was the victim's!
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 4
Testimony: Also, there was blood found on the victim's finger!
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 5
Testimony: Before she died, the victim wrote the killer's name!
Person: Gumshoe

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me start by going through the details provided.

First, the characters involved are Mia Fey, Maya Fey, Dick Gumshoe, Miles Edgeworth, April May, Marvin Grossberg, Bellboy, and Redd White. The main suspect is Maya Fey, who is Mia's sister, and she's being accused of killing her sister Cindy. There's also Larry Butz involved, but I don't think he's a suspect here. The prosecutor is Miles Edgeworth, and the defense is handled by Marvin Grossberg.

Looking at the evidence, there's a lot to unpack. Evidence 0 is the Attorney's Badge, which seems more like a character trait than something that affects the case. Evidence 1 is the Thinker, which is described as a murder weapon that looks like a statue but is actually a clock. The gears have been removed. Evidence 2 is Glass Shards, which are remains of a glass light stand that's been broken beyond recognition. Evidence 3 is a Receipt for a glass light stand, bought the day before the murder. Evidence 4 is Maya's Memo, which contains a conversation she had with her sister, possibly recorded on her cell phone. Evidence 5 is Mia's Autopsy Report, showing she died at 9:00PM from a single blunt force trauma, which was instantaneous. Evidence 6 is Maya's Cell Phone, which has a conversation between Mia and Maya. Evidence 7 is a Wiretap found in Maya's hotel room. Evidence 8 are Floor Plans of the Fey & Co. Law Offices. Evidence 9 is May Testimony, where she says the victim dodged an attack and ran to the right but was caught and struck. Evidence 10 and 11 are Photographs with notes about the DL-6 Incident, labeled Exhibit A and B. Evidence 12 is Bellboy's Affidavit, describing a man who stayed with Maya in the hotel the night of the murder. Evidence 13 is a Newspaper Clipping about a politician's suicide with "White" written on top. Evidence 14 is Mia's Memo, a list of names in her handwriting.

Now, the testimonies:

Testimony 0: Dick Gumshoe says he examined the crime scene with his own eyes after securing the suspect. Testimony 1: He found a memo next to the victim's body. Testimony 2: The memo had "Maya" written clearly in blood. Testimony 3: Lab results showed the blood was the victim's. Testimony 4: Blood was found on the victim's finger. Testimony 5: Before dying, the victim wrote the killer's name.

So, the testimonies seem to be from Dick Gumshoe, the detective, about findings at the crime scene. The evidence includes things like the Thinker (the murder weapon), Glass Shards, a Receipt, Maya's Memo, Mia's Autopsy Report, Maya's Cell Phone, a Wiretap, Floor Plans, May Testimony, Photographs, Bellboy's Affidavit, a Newspaper Clipping, and Mia's Memo again.

I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let's look at the testimonies first. Testimony 2 says that the memo next to the body had "Maya" written in blood. Evidence 4 is the Receipt for a glass light stand, which was bought the day before the murder. The Receipt seems unrelated to the memo with "Maya" in blood. So, perhaps the Receipt doesn't contradict anything, but the memo with "Maya" in blood is a key point.

Wait, but the testimonies are about the memo, and the evidence includes the Receipt. Maybe the Receipt is from a different place, but it's not directly conflicting. Let me think differently.

Looking at Testimony 5: The victim wrote the killer's name before dying. But Mia's Autopsy Report (Evidence 5) shows she died instantly from a single blow. If she wrote the killer's name, that would imply she was conscious for a while after the blow, but the autopsy says it was instantaneous. That seems contradictory.

So, Evidence 5 (Mia's Autopsy Report) states she died immediately, but Testimony 5 (the victim wrote the killer's name) implies she was alive long enough to write, which contradicts the autopsy report.

Alternatively, maybe I'm misassigning evidence numbers. Let me double-check:

Evidence 5 is Mia's Autopsy Report: Time of death 9/5 at 9:00PM, cause of death single blunt force trauma, died instantly. Evidence 4 is the Receipt, which is about a glass light stand purchase the day before the murder. Testimony 5 is about the victim writing the killer's name before dying.

Wait, so the victim is Cindy Stone, and the killer is Maya Fey. If Cindy wrote the killer's name before dying, but the autopsy says she died instantly, that would mean she couldn't have written anything after the blow. So, Testimony 5 would contradict Evidence 5.

Therefore, the pair that contradicts is Evidence 5 (Mia's Autopsy Report) and Testimony 5 (the victim wrote the killer's name before dying). This is because the autopsy says she died immediately, but the testimony suggests she was conscious long enough to write, which is impossible if she died instantly.
</think>
